result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanton L Klamik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 87 days were granted if imposed.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM0767

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint. Report to probation by 10/28/15. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Case 15CM1408 was dismissed and read in.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (ie. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stanton L Klamik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Return to Sender - Not at this address.
Judgment for Unpaid fines, forfeitures and other financial obligations.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 12/23/15
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stanton L Klamik in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty   


Court orders the following:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
87 Days Credit.
Concurrent with:  15CM1130
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent with:  15CM1130
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact probation by 9 am. tomorrow morning 10/28/15.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Carl William Chesshir in court, defendant Stanton L Klamik not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Chesshir waives his clients appearance.
Defense waiting on a global offer on all 3 files.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stanton L Klamik in court, in custody, with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Faxed Copy:
Filed by Atty. Chesshir, requesting to reschedule today's court date, including fax cover sheet.
07/21/15 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Matter to be rescheduled.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Case not called on the record. Attorney Carl William Chesshir in court.   Defendant Stanton L Klamik did not appear.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney appears by authorization.  Authorization to appear received and filed.
State provided discovery to Attorney Chesshir.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with business (Discount Liquor) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Stanton L Klamik in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorn  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
